intro: Petrocoma hoefftiana var. glabra, commonly known as the smooth petrocoma, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many species with milky sap and showy flowers. The plant is characterized by its smooth, glabrous stems and leaves, which contribute to its common name. It typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, adapting to harsh conditions with its succulent-like features. The flowers are usually yellow or orange, attracting pollinators such as bees and birds.
